Submodules¶

apps_logging_app.databases.base module¶

class apps_logging_app.databases.base.BaseDatabase(config)[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for asynchronous database clients.

The BaseDatabase defines a common execution model for database interactions based on an internal queue, a dispatcher thread, and a thread pool executor. Queries are enqueued and executed asynchronously, returning a concurrent.futures.Future to the caller.

This class is responsible for:

  • Managing the lifecycle of the database connection

  • Dispatching query tasks from a queue to a worker pool

  • Handling retries with exponential backoff on failures

  • Coordinating connection state via an external orchestrator

  • Providing a uniform interface for different database implementations

Concrete database implementations must provide:

  • Connection management logic

  • Query execution logic

Subclasses are required to implement the following abstract methods:

  • connect()

  • close()

  • _query()

Instances of this class are typically created and managed by a database factory and used by agents to execute queries asynchronously.

Parameters:

config (BaseDatabaseConfig) – Configuration object containing database connection parameters and execution settings.

start()[source]¶

Starts the database dispatcher thread, which picks up queries from the queue and submits them to the thread pool executor for execution.

Return type:

None

enqueue_query(query, params=None)[source]¶

Enqueues a query to be executed by the database dispatcher thread.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The SQL or database query string to be executed.

  • params (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Optional dictionary of parameters to be passed to the query.

Returns:

A concurrent.futures.Future object that will hold the result of the query.

Return type:

Future[List[Dict[str, Any]]]

Raises:

Exception if the queue is full or an error occurs while putting the query.

stop(timeout=None)[source]¶

Shuts down the database dispatcher thread, waits for all queued tasks to finish, joins the queue, shuts down the executor, and closes the database connection.

Parameters:

timeout (float | None) – Optional timeout in seconds to wait for the dispatcher thread to finish.

Returns:

None

Raises:

None

Return type:

None

abstractmethod connect()[source]¶

Establish a connection to the database.

Raises:

Exception if connection fails

Return type:

None

abstractmethod close()[source]¶

Closes the database connection.

Raises:

None

Return type:

None

apps_logging_app.databases.factory module¶

class apps_logging_app.databases.factory.DatabaseFactory[source]¶

Bases: object

Factory and singleton manager for database instances.

The DatabaseFactory is responsible for creating and managing shared instances of databases based on their type and name. Each database instance is created once and cached globally to ensure that the same connection and execution resources are reused across the application.

Database configurations are loaded lazily from a YAML configuration file and validated using the configuration model registered in DATABASE_REGISTRY.

Thread safety is guaranteed during instance creation via a class-level lock.

Responsibilities include:

  • Loading database configurations from YAML

  • Validating configurations using registered config models

  • Instantiating concrete database implementations

  • Wiring databases with a DatabaseOrchestrator

  • Starting database dispatcher threads

  • Caching and returning shared database instances

Database types must be registered in DATABASE_REGISTRY prior to usage.

This class should not be instantiated. All interactions are performed via class methods.

classmethod get_instance(database_type, database_name)[source]¶

Returns a shared database instance for the given type and name.

The instance is cached globally, and subsequent calls with the same database type and name will return the same instance.

Parameters:

  • database_type (str) – The type of the database (must be registered in DATABASE_REGISTRY).

  • database_name (str) – The name of the database (must exist in the YAML config).

Returns:

The shared database instance.

Return type:

BaseDatabase

apps_logging_app.databases.model module¶

class apps_logging_app.databases.model.QueryTask(query, params=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a single database query execution task.

The QueryTask encapsulates a query string, optional parameters, and a concurrent.futures.Future used to retrieve the asynchronous execution result.

Instances of this class are enqueued by BaseDatabase and processed by the database dispatcher and worker threads.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The SQL or database query string to be executed.

  • params (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Optional dictionary of parameters to be passed to the query.

class apps_logging_app.databases.model.ConnectionConfig(*, host, port, service_name)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Configuration model defining a database connection endpoint.

This model represents connection details for a database instance, including host, port, and optional service name. It is used for both primary and replica connections.

Parameters:

  • host (str) – Hostname or IP address of the database server.

  • port (int) – Network port of the database server.

  • service_name (Optional[str]) – Optional service or database name.

host: str¶
port: int¶
service_name: str | None¶
classmethod validate_host(v)[source]¶

Validates the host field of the ConnectionConfig model.

Parameters:

v – The value of the host field.

Raises:

ValueError – If the host is empty or not a valid hostname or IP address.

Returns:

The validated host value.

classmethod validate_port(v)[source]¶

Validates the port field of the ConnectionConfig model.

Parameters:

v – The value of the port field.

Raises:

ValueError – If the port is not an integer between 1 and 65535.

Returns:

The validated port value.

model_config = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class apps_logging_app.databases.model.BaseDatabaseConfig(*, type, name, username, password, primary, replica=None, max_retries=5, max_workers=10)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base configuration model for database instances.

This model defines connection credentials, primary and replica endpoints, and execution parameters controlling concurrency and retry behavior.

It is validated when database instances are created by the DatabaseFactory.

Parameters:

  • type (str) – Type identifier of the database.

  • name (str) – Name of the database instance.

  • username (str) – Username used for authentication.

  • password (str) – Password used for authentication.

  • primary (ConnectionConfig) – Primary database connection configuration.

  • replica (Optional[ConnectionConfig]) – Optional replica database connection configuration.

  • max_retries (int) – Maximum number of retries for failed queries.

  • max_workers (int) – Maximum number of concurrent worker threads.

type: str¶
name: str¶
username: str¶
password: str¶
primary: ConnectionConfig¶
replica: ConnectionConfig | None¶
max_retries: int¶
max_workers: int¶
classmethod validate_max_retries(value)[source]¶

Validates the max retries field of the BaseDatabaseConfig model.

Parameters:

value – The value of the max retries field.

Raises:

ValueError – If the max retries is less than or equal to 0.

Returns:

The validated max retries value.

classmethod validate_max_workers(value)[source]¶

Validates the max workers field of the BaseDatabaseConfig model.

Parameters:

value – The value of the max workers field.

Raises:

ValueError – If the max workers is less than or equal to 0.

Returns:

The validated max workers value.

model_config = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

apps_logging_app.databases.orchestrator module¶

class apps_logging_app.databases.orchestrator.DatabaseOrchestrator(database)[source]¶

Bases: BaseOrchestrator

Orchestrator for managing the lifecycle and connectivity of a database instance.

The DatabaseOrchestrator wraps a BaseDatabase instance and provides thread-safe connection management, retry handling, and orchestration of database operations. It ensures that queries are only executed when the database is connected and handles reconnect attempts transparently.

database¶

The database instance managed by this orchestrator.

Type:

BaseDatabase

Parameters:

database (BaseDatabase) – The database instance to manage.

Notes

This orchestrator is intended to be used internally by the DatabaseFactory and the BaseDatabase dispatcher.

close()[source]¶

Closes the database connection and marks the orchestrator as disconnected.

This method is thread-safe and idempotent.

Return type:

None

apps_logging_app.databases.registry module¶

class apps_logging_app.databases.registry.DatabaseEntry[source]¶

Bases: Generic[C]

Represents a registry entry for a database type.

Each DatabaseEntry binds a database class to its corresponding configuration model. It is used internally by the DATABASE_REGISTRY to map database types to their implementation and configuration schema.

config_model¶

The Pydantic configuration model class associated with this database. This model defines the structure and validation rules for the database configuration.

Type:

Type[C]

database_class¶

The actual database class associated with this entry. This class must inherit from BaseDatabase.

Type:

Type[BaseDatabase]

Notes

Instances of this class are typically created automatically by the register_database() decorator and stored in DATABASE_REGISTRY. You generally do not instantiate this class manually.

config_model: Type[C]¶
database_class: Type[BaseDatabase]¶
apps_logging_app.databases.registry.register_database(*, database_type, config_model)[source]¶

A decorator that registers a database class with the given config model and type.

The decorator sets the type attribute of the database class to the given type. It also creates a DatabaseEntry and adds it to the DATABASE_REGISTRY with the given type as the key.

Parameters:

  • database_class (Type[BaseDatabase]) – The database class to register.

  • database_type (str)

  • config_model (Type[BaseDatabaseConfig])

Returns:

The registered database class.

Return type:

Type[BaseDatabase]
